CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Ward, Uptown and Mrs. Beverley Schenck, unemployed, Hill District, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 2, 1961, pg. 7, with question: " Do you think police could wipe out all the rackets if they launched an intense, earnest campaign against vice and crime?"  Mr. Ward's answer reads: "I believe it would be possible."  Mrs. Schenck's answer reads: "Yes, 'if' - which is a crooked word - they launched a campaign which was sincerely for the betterment of the community concerned, but why should they lose their jobs?  In my business, there have been many times when I've had to call the police to make an arrest and they wouldn't do it.  Yet, they always manage to get their payoffs.  Should I go farther?"
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Charles Ward wearing straw hat, seated on sidewalk in front of two parked automobiles; Portrait of Beverley Schenck wearing light colored t-shirt, standing in front of store window with sale sign
